t: Proverbs 4
Security in Wisdom
Hear,*pn my*i children, the instruction of a father, And*ld give attention to know understanding;
For*ld I give you good doctrine: Do*ld not forsake my law.
When*ld I was my father’s son, Tender*ld and the only one in the sight of my mother,
He*ld also taught me, and said to me: “Let*ld your heart retain my words; Keep*ld my commands, and live.
Get*ld wisdom! Get understanding! Do*ld not forget, nor turn away from the words of my mouth.
Do*ld not forsake her, and she will preserve you; Love*ld her, and she will keep you.
Wisdom*ld is*i the principal thing; Therefore*ild get wisdom. And*ld in all your getting, get understanding.
Exalt*ld her, and she will promote you; She*ld will bring you honor, when you embrace her.
She*ld will place on your head an ornament of grace; A*ld crown of glory she will deliver to you.”
Hear,*ln my son, and receive my sayings, And*ld the years of your life will be many.
I*ld have taught you in the way of wisdom; I*ld have led you in right paths.
When*ld you walk, your steps will not be hindered, And*ld when you run, you will not stumble.
Take*ld firm hold of instruction, do not let go; Keep*ld her, for she is*i your life.
Do*ln not enter the path of the wicked, And*ld do not walk in the way of evil.
Avoid*ld it, do not travel on it; Turn*ld away from it and pass on.
For*ld they do not sleep unless they have done evil; And*ld their sleep is taken away unless they make someone*i fall.
For*ld they eat the bread of wickedness, And*ld drink the wine of violence.
But*ln the path of the just is*i like the shining sun, That*ld shines ever brighter unto the perfect day.
The*ld way of the wicked is*i like darkness; They*ld do not know what makes them stumble.
My*ln son, give attention to my words; Incline*ld your ear to my sayings.
Do*ld not let them depart from your eyes; Keep*ld them in the midst of your heart;
For*ld they are*i life to those who find them, And*ld health to all their flesh.
Keep*ld your heart with all diligence, For*ld out of it spring*i the issues of life.
Put*ld away from you a deceitful mouth, And*ld put perverse lips far from you.
Let*ld your eyes look straight ahead, And*ld your eyelids look right before you.
Ponder*ld the path of your feet, And*ld let all your ways be established.
Do*ld not turn to the right or the left; Remove*ld your foot from evil.
